intro: Scurrula amplexifolia, commonly known as the clasping scurrula, is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its hairy, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves that often wrap around the stem. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the leaf axils. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Scurrula amplexifolia is notable for its unique leaf morphology and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
